data.name: labTime.ToolTip
data.value:
Travel time in seconds.
NOTE:
1) This time includes waiting times, if the calculateTour method is used.
2) In case of a road blocking on the static route the dynamic time on static route resp. Td(Rs) is infinite.
If so parameter time is set to -1 provided that DYNAMIC_TIME_ON_STATICROUTE is set to 'true'.
3) Otherwise negative values show error codes.

data.name: tbxTime.ToolTip
data.value:
Travel time in seconds.
NOTE:
1) This time includes waiting times, if the calculateTour method is used.
2) In case of a road blocking on the static route the dynamic time on static route resp. Td(Rs) is infinite.
If so parameter time is set to -1 provided that DYNAMIC_TIME_ON_STATICROUTE is set to 'true'.
3) Otherwise negative values show error codes.

data.name: tbxPartTime.ToolTip
data.value:
Travel time in seconds.
NOTE:
1) This time includes waiting times, if the calculateTour method is used.
2) In case of a road blocking on the static route the dynamic time on static route resp. Td(Rs) is infinite.
If so parameter time is set to -1 provided that DYNAMIC_TIME_ON_STATICROUTE is set to 'true'.
3) Otherwise negative values show error codes.

data.name: lbx_PerTypeTollPrice.ToolTip
data.value: Array of toll prices based on the toll types (e.g. city toll, charge for ferry). Please note that the price is given in subunits of the currency, i.e. if currency is Euro, the price is given in Eurocents. If the currency consists of 1000 subunits, the price is given in 10 subunits.

data.name: cboLinkTypeDest.ToolTip
data.value:
NEXT_NODE The Waypoint has to be linked to the geographically nearest valid node within the configured link distance. A node is valid if it can be used by the configured vehicle type.
NEXT_SEGMENT The Waypoint has to be linked to the geographically nearest valid segment within the configured link distance. A segment is valid if it can be used by the configured vehicle type.
NEXT_MAIN_NODE The Waypoint has to be linked to the geographically nearest valid main node (e.g., a motorway interchange )within the configured link distance. A main node is a collection of entry-nodes representing the interchange, and it is valid if it can be used by the configured vehicle type. A main-node is a collection of entry-nodes representing the interchange.
FUZZY_LINKING The Waypoint has to be linked by fuzzy linking according to a given radius. NOTE: FUZZY_LINKING is only valid for VIA-Points.
AUTO_LINKING The Waypoint has to be linked by auto linking according to the following three steps. 1. Use link-type NEXT_SEGMENT. 2. If the segment is not a motorway, take the segment. Otherwise, we may accidentally have the segment in the wrong direction, since motorways have usually seperate lanes. Because of this the segment is rejected and in a second step link-type NEXT_MAIN_NODE is used. 3. If NEXT_MAIN_NODE is used it is checked if one entry node of the main node is a toll station. In this case all toll nodes are returned which belong to toll station with the minimal distance to the main node.
NEXT_MAIN_TOLL_NODE This LinkType is not supported anymore, please use a different one.
TOLL_STATION The Waypoint has to be linked to the geographically nearest valid toll station within the configured link distance. A toll station is valid if it can be used by the configured vehicle type.
TI_LINKING Linking is executed in two steps: 1. Use link-type NEXT_MAIN_NODE. If some segments adjacent to an entry-nodes of the resulting main-node has the wanted name, take all these entry-nodes. 2. Otherwise, consider all segments within a given radius.

data.name: cboLinkTypeStart.ToolTip
data.value:
NEXT_NODE The Waypoint has to be linked to the geographically nearest valid node within the configured link distance. A node is valid if it can be used by the configured vehicle type.
NEXT_SEGMENT The Waypoint has to be linked to the geographically nearest valid segment within the configured link distance. A segment is valid if it can be used by the configured vehicle type.
NEXT_MAIN_NODE The Waypoint has to be linked to the geographically nearest valid main node (e.g., a motorway interchange )within the configured link distance. A main node is a collection of entry-nodes representing the interchange, and it is valid if it can be used by the configured vehicle type. A main-node is a collection of entry-nodes representing the interchange.
FUZZY_LINKING The Waypoint has to be linked by fuzzy linking according to a given radius. NOTE: FUZZY_LINKING is only valid for VIA-Points.
AUTO_LINKING The Waypoint has to be linked by auto linking according to the following three steps. 1. Use link-type NEXT_SEGMENT. 2. If the segment is not a motorway, take the segment. Otherwise, we may accidentally have the segment in the wrong direction, since motorways have usually seperate lanes. Because of this the segment is rejected and in a second step link-type NEXT_MAIN_NODE is used. 3. If NEXT_MAIN_NODE is used it is checked if one entry node of the main node is a toll station. In this case all toll nodes are returned which belong to toll station with the minimal distance to the main node.
NEXT_MAIN_TOLL_NODE This LinkType is not supported anymore, please use a different one.
TOLL_STATION The Waypoint has to be linked to the geographically nearest valid toll station within the configured link distance. A toll station is valid if it can be used by the configured vehicle type.
TI_LINKING Linking is executed in two steps: 1. Use link-type NEXT_MAIN_NODE. If some segments adjacent to an entry-nodes of the resulting main-node has the wanted name, take all these entry-nodes. 2. Otherwise, consider all segments within a given radius.

data.name: labServiceRoute.ToolTip
data.value:
Service address of the xRoute endpoint, e.g. http://127.0.0.1:50030/xroute/ws/XRoute
Please be aware of the fact that some systems require username and password for the basic authentication. Username and passwort are configureable in the test clients config file. Please use the keys xroute_username and xroute_password

data.name: tbxSPEED_INFOS.ToolTip
data.value: The low emission zone type of the vehicle. The low emission zone can be set by one of these identifiers: 0 (NO low emission zone) 1 (GREEN low emission zone) 2 (YELLOW low emission zone) 3 (RED low emission zone) Default is 1 Note: LOW_EMISSION_ZONE_TYPE will always overwrite the "routingParameter.LowEmissionZoneType" in property file

data.name: tbxGENERATE_EXTWAYPOINTS.ToolTip
data.value: The low emission zone type of the vehicle. The low emission zone can be set by one of these identifiers: 0 (NO low emission zone) 1 (GREEN low emission zone) 2 (YELLOW low emission zone) 3 (RED low emission zone) Default is 1 Note: LOW_EMISSION_ZONE_TYPE will always overwrite the "routingParameter.LowEmissionZoneType" in property file

data.name: labROUTE_LANGUAGE.ToolTip
data.value: Defines the language which has to be used for the directions in the route description calculation legal values are (ISO 639-1-Codes) BG - bulgarian BS - bosnian CS - czech DA - danish DE - german EN - english ES - spanish FR - french HR - croatian IT - italian NL - dutch PL - polish PT - portuguese RO - romanian RU - russian SK - slovak SR - serbian SL - slovenian SV - swedish UK - ukrainian Additional languages can be manually added to the file conf/RLTrans_ISO639-1.xml.

data.name: tbxROUTE_LANGUAGE.ToolTip
data.value:
Defines the language which has to used for the directions
in the route description calculation
legal values are (ISO 639-1-Codes)
DE - german
EN - english
FR - french
NL - dutch
ES - spanish
PT - portuguese
IT - italian
SV - swedish
DA - danish

data.name: tbxLOW_EMISSION_ZONE_TYPE.ToolTip
data.value: The low emission zone type of the vehicle. The low emission zone can be set by one of these identifiers: 0 (NO low emission zone) 1 (GREEN low emission zone) 2 (YELLOW low emission zone) 3 (RED low emission zone) Default is 1 Note: LOW_EMISSION_ZONE_TYPE will always overwrite the "routingParameter.LowEmissionZoneType" in property file

data.name: labLOW_EMISSION_ZONE_TYPE.ToolTip
data.value: The low emission zone type of the vehicle. The low emission zone can be set by one of these identifiers: 0 (NO low emission zone) 1 (GREEN low emission zone) 2 (YELLOW low emission zone) 3 (RED low emission zone) Default is 1 Note: LOW_EMISSION_ZONE_TYPE will always overwrite the "routingParameter.LowEmissionZoneType" in property file

data.name: tbxCOUNTRY_ENCODING.ToolTip
data.value:
Defines if and how the optional countryCode string-attribute in the RouteListSegment and WayPoint Objects has to be filled.
If this option isn't set the countryCode string-attribute will not be set.
This option can also be set in the properties file, but will be overwritten when set as RoutingParameter
Possible values are:
*
ISO2 *
ISO3

data.name: labCOUNTRY_ENCODING.ToolTip
data.value:
Defines if and how the optional countryCode string-attribute in the RouteListSegment and WayPoint Objects has to be filled.
If this option isn't set the countryCode string-attribute will not be set.
This option can also be set in the properties file, but will be overwritten when set as RoutingParameter
Possible values are:
*
ISO2 *
ISO3

data.name: tbxROUTING_COUNTRIES.ToolTip
data.value:
Defines a list of countries to use exclusively in route calculation
the list has to be described as a string of comma separated values
legal values are integration unit codes
NOTE: Only one of the parameters ExludeCountries and RoutingCountries can be set
see also EXCLUDE_COUNTRIES

data.name: labROUTING_COUNTRIES.ToolTip
data.value:
Defines a list of countries to use exclusively in route calculation
the list has to be described as a string of comma separated values
legal values are integration unit codes
NOTE: Only one of the parameters ExludeCountries and RoutingCountries can be set
see also EXCLUDE_COUNTRIES

data.name: labEXCLUDE_COUNTRIES.ToolTip
data.value:
Defines a list of countries to ban in route calculation
the list has to be described as a string of comma separated values
legal values are integration unit codes
NOTE: Only one of the parameters ExludeCountries and RoutingCountries can be set
see also ROUTING_COUNTRIES

data.name: tbxEXCLUDE_COUNTRIES.ToolTip
data.value:
Defines a list of countries to ban in route calculation
the list has to be described as a string of comma separated values
legal values are integration unit codes
NOTE: Only one of the parameters ExludeCountries and RoutingCountries can be set
see also ROUTING_COUNTRIES

data.name: tbxSPEEDPROFILE.ToolTip
data.value: Defines the speed profile In general the speed profile is part of a vehicle profile if this option is set in the request it dominates the value defined in the profile the speed profile has to be described as a string of 16 comma separated values representing the 2 speed per network class

data.name: labSPEEDPROFILE.ToolTip
data.value: Defines the speed profile In general the speed profile is part of a vehicle profile if this option is set in the request it dominates the value defined in the profile the speed profile has to be described as a string of 16 comma separated values representing the 2 speed per network class

data.name: labOPTIMIZATION.ToolTip
data.value: Defines the optimization In general the optimization is part of a vehicle profile if this option is set in the request it dominates the value defined in the profile Legal values are integers in the range 0..100 30 - shortest 90 - fastest

data.name: tbxOPTIMIZATION.ToolTip
data.value: Defines the optimization In general the optimization is part of a vehicle profile if this option is set in the request it dominates the value defined in the profile Legal values are integers in the range 0..100 30 - shortest 90 - fastest

data.name: gbxRoutingOptions.ToolTip
data.value: Represents one routing option. The option type is described by the enumeration RoutingParameter All RoutingOptions are optional and have default values defined in the default properties definition file. Each RoutingOption can be assigned to a certain vehicle profile If a RoutingOption is set in the request it dominates the entry in the appropriate properties definition file.

data.name: tbxROADEDITOR_LAYERNAME.ToolTip
data.value: This parameter has to be used for roadeditor routing. Legal values are strings representing: 1) a valid roadeditor layer name without extension 2) the name of the sub-folder in which an adequate roadeditor layer should be present 3) an attribute set, indicated by the extension ".db" such as "attribute1.db". Given attribute must correspond with database entry. In this case the roadeditor has to be in database mode, being set by roadeditor parameter "reDBConnection" in xroute.properties NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_ROADEDITOR is true.

data.name: labROADEDITOR_LAYERNAME.ToolTip
data.value: This parameter has to be used for roadeditor routing. Legal values are strings representing: 1) a valid roadeditor layer name without extension 2) the name of the sub-folder in which an adequate roadeditor layer should be present 3) an attribute set, indicated by the extension ".db" such as "attribute1.db". Given attribute must correspond with database entry. In this case the roadeditor has to be in database mode, being set by roadeditor parameter "reDBConnection" in xroute.properties NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_ROADEDITOR is true.

data.name: labSTART_TIME_ROADEDITOR.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the starting time of the route
in case of roadeditor routing
the time has to be described as a string using the TimeInstant syntax
Example: 1999-05-31T13:20:00-05:00
if this parameter isn't set it is assumed as now.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_ROADEDITOR is true.

data.name: tbxSTART_TIME_ROADEDITOR.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the starting time of the route
in case of roadeditor routing
the time has to be described as a string using the TimeInstant syntax
Example: 1999-05-31T13:20:00-05:00
if this parameter isn't set it is assumed as now.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_ROADEDITOR is true.

data.name: tbxROADEDITOR_ADDITIONAL_OPTIONS.ToolTip
data.value: Describes additional RoadEditor options. This is a free text option field to set several additional RoadEditor options. Additional options are comma separated <key>=<value> pairs. Legal values are described in the the enum RoadEditorOptions. NOTE: These options don't have any effect on CountryInfoVehicleOptions. NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_ROADEDITOR is true.

data.name: labROADEDITOR_ADDITIONAL_OPTIONS.ToolTip
data.value: Describes additional RoadEditor options. This is a free text option field to set several additional RoadEditor options. Additional options are comma separated <key>=<value> pairs. Legal values are described in the the enum RoadEditorOptions. NOTE: These options don't have any effect on CountryInfoVehicleOptions. NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_ROADEDITOR is true.

data.name: labDYNAMIC_PROFILE.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the dynamic profile which has to be used for dynamic routing.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_DYNAMIC is true.
Legal values are strings representing a valid dynamic profile

data.name: tbxDYNAMIC_PROFILE.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the dynamic profile which has to be used for dynamic routing.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_DYNAMIC is true.
Legal values are strings representing a valid dynamic profile

data.name: tbxSTART_TIME.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the starting time or the arrival time (if IS_DESTTIME is set to true) of the route
in case of dynamic routing
the time has to be described as a string using the TimeInstant syntax
Example: 1999-05-31T13:20:00-05:00
if this parameter isn't set it is assumed as now.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_DYNAMIC is true.

data.name: labSTART_TIME.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the starting time or the arrival time (if IS_DESTTIME is set to true) of the route
in case of dynamic routing
the time has to be described as a string using the TimeInstant syntax
Example: 1999-05-31T13:20:00-05:00
if this parameter isn't set it is assumed as now.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_DYNAMIC is true.

data.name: labAVOID_RAMPS.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of ramps. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. The default is 10. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: labAVOID_URBAN_AREAS.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of road segments in urban areas. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: tbxAVOID_RAMPS.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of ramps. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. The default is 10. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: tbxAVOID_URBAN_AREAS.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of road segments in urban areas. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: tbxAVOID_RESIDENTS_ONLY.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of residents-only streets. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. The default is 2500. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: tbxAVOID_FERRIES.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of ferries. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. The default is 100. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: tbxAVOID_HIGHWAYS.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of highways. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: labAVOID_RESIDENTS_ONLY.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of residents-only streets. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. The default is 2500. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: labAVOID_FERRIES.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of ferries. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. The default is 100. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: labAVOID_HIGHWAYS.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of highways. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: tbxAVOID_VIGNETTEROADS.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of vignette roads. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: labAVOID_VIGNETTEROADS.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of vignette roads. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: labAVOID_TOLLROADS.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of toll roads. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: tbxAVOID_TOLLROADS.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of toll roads. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: labServiceMap.ToolTip
data.value:
Service address of the xRoute endpoint, e.g. http://127.0.0.1:50010/xmap/ws/XMap
Please be aware of the fact that some systems require username and password for the basic authentication. Username and passwort are configureable in the test clients config file. Please use the keys xmap_username and xmap_password

data.name: tollPriceDataGridViewTextBoxColumn.ToolTipText
data.value: Price for the toll section (can be 0 for citytoll/vignette in case of reentering). Please note that the price is given in subunits of the currency, i.e. if currency is Euro, the price is given in Eurocents. If the currency consists of 1000 subunits, the price is given in 10 subunits.

data.name: tollSectionNameDataGridViewTextBoxColumn.ToolTipText
data.value: The name for the toll section according to the sectionID, empty if this country has global toll (vignette). NOTE: This is an optional attribute and is set only if the REQUEST_VERSION is set to 1.4.5 or higher

data.name: gbxOutCountries.ToolTip
data.value: Displays the total amount of toll price to be payed in the passed countries. If all the occuring currencies are given in €, the client computes an additional aggregate: The concatenation of all the country infos to a global list.

data.name: cboCoordFormat.ToolTip
data.value:
NEXT_NODE The Waypoint has to be linked to the geographically nearest valid node within the configured link distance. A node is valid if it can be used by the configured vehicle type.
NEXT_SEGMENT The Waypoint has to be linked to the geographically nearest valid segment within the configured link distance. A segment is valid if it can be used by the configured vehicle type.
NEXT_MAIN_NODE The Waypoint has to be linked to the geographically nearest valid main node (e.g., a motorway interchange )within the configured link distance. A main node is a collection of entry-nodes representing the interchange, and it is valid if it can be used by the configured vehicle type. A main-node is a collection of entry-nodes representing the interchange.
FUZZY_LINKING The Waypoint has to be linked by fuzzy linking according to a given radius. NOTE: FUZZY_LINKING is only valid for VIA-Points.
AUTO_LINKING The Waypoint has to be linked by auto linking according to the following three steps. 1. Use link-type NEXT_SEGMENT. 2. If the segment is not a motorway, take the segment. Otherwise, we may accidentally have the segment in the wrong direction, since motorways have usually seperate lanes. Because of this the segment is rejected and in a second step link-type NEXT_MAIN_NODE is used. 3. If NEXT_MAIN_NODE is used it is checked if one entry node of the main node is a toll station. In this case all toll nodes are returned which belong to toll station with the minimal distance to the main node.
NEXT_MAIN_TOLL_NODE This LinkType is not supported anymore, please use a different one.
TOLL_STATION The Waypoint has to be linked to the geographically nearest valid toll station within the configured link distance. A toll station is valid if it can be used by the configured vehicle type.
TI_LINKING Linking is executed in two steps: 1. Use link-type NEXT_MAIN_NODE. If some segments adjacent to an entry-nodes of the resulting main-node has the wanted name, take all these entry-nodes. 2. Otherwise, consider all segments within a given radius.

data.name: tbxTolldate.ToolTip
data.value:
The underlying map may contain different toll scenarios for each country. These scenarios are valid from a specified date. If toll date is set, xRoute will use the according scenario for each country. Note that individual scenarios can be overwritten with the attribute tollScenarios.
The scenarios can be found in the file TollScenarios.ini in your map path (if available). The first column specifies the scenario id. The second column represents the country id and the 7th coulumn 'VALIDFROM' defines the starting date for this scenario given in the form YYYYMMDD.

data.name: gbxCountryInfoOptions.ToolTip
data.value: Defines a set of reduction types being relevant for calculating toll costs either in its currency or in euro if desired. All of the costs are calculated per cent. Furthermore the generation of detailed toll costs can be activated.

data.name: labDYNAMIC_TIME_ON_STATICROUTE.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the dynamic profile which has to be used for dynamic routing.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_DYNAMIC is true.
Legal values are strings representing a valid dynamic profile

data.name: labENABLE_DYNAMIC.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the dynamic profile which has to be used for dynamic routing.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_DYNAMIC is true.
Legal values are strings representing a valid dynamic profile

data.name: tbxENABLE_DYNAMIC.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the dynamic profile which has to be used for dynamic routing.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_DYNAMIC is true.
Legal values are strings representing a valid dynamic profile

data.name: tbxDYNAMIC_TIME_ON_STATICROUTE.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the dynamic profile which has to be used for dynamic routing.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_DYNAMIC is true.
Legal values are strings representing a valid dynamic profile

data.name: labIS_DESTTIME.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the dynamic profile which has to be used for dynamic routing.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_DYNAMIC is true.
Legal values are strings representing a valid dynamic profile

data.name: tbxIS_DESTTIME.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the dynamic profile which has to be used for dynamic routing.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_DYNAMIC is true.
Legal values are strings representing a valid dynamic profile

data.name: gbxDynamic.ToolTip
data.value: Represents one routing option. The option type is described by the enumeration RoutingParameter All RoutingOptions are optional and have default values defined in the default properties definition file. Each RoutingOption can be assigned to a certain vehicle profile If a RoutingOption is set in the request it dominates the entry in the appropriate properties definition file.

data.name: gbxRouteInfo.ToolTip
data.value: Summary information about a single route NOTE: negative values in either the distance, time or costfield show error codes Example: If for example a 100 x 100 Matrix should be calculated and only one location cannot be linked to the roadnetwork due to linking restrictions, then only one single row and one single column cannot be calculated. In this case all these relations have negative values (error codes) in the distance and time fields. NOTE: cost / distance / time will be set to "0" when all stations are identical in request

data.name: labPerTypeTollPrice.ToolTip
data.value: Array of toll prices based on the toll types (e.g. city toll, charge for ferry). Please note that the price is given in subunits of the currency, i.e. if currency is Euro, the price is given in Eurocents. If the currency consists of 1000 subunits, the price is given in 10 subunits.

data.name: cboHBEFAVersion.ToolTip
data.value:
This enumeration holds constants for different HBEFA versions.
Attributes: name type value description HBEFA_2_1 HBEFAVersion 0 HBEFA 2.1. This is the default. HBEFA_3_1 HBEFAVersion 1 HBEFA 3.1.

data.name: cboEmissionLevel.ToolTip
data.value:
Enumeration EmissionLevel
Determines at which level the emissions of the route are to be calculated, i.e. which result list elements are to be returned.
Attributes: name type value description NONE EmissionLevel 0 No emission calculation. BASIC EmissionLevel 1 Only the total amount of emissions. SEGMENTS EmissionLevel 2 The total amount of emissions and the emissions per segment. STATIONS EmissionLevel 3 The total amount of emissions and the emissions per station. ALL EmissionLevel 4 The total amount of emissions and the emissions per segment and per station.

data.name: labManoeuvreGroupsRatio.ToolTip
data.value: Optional value representing the height/width ratio of the ManoevreGroup.extend representing the bounding rectangle. If the ratio is 1 height and width are equal. NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if manoeuvreGroups is true

data.name: tbxManoeuvreGroupsRatio.ToolTip
data.value: Optional value representing the height/width ratio of the ManoevreGroup.extend representing the bounding rectangle. If the ratio is 1 height and width are equal. NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if manoeuvreGroups is true

data.name: radCalcRoute.ToolTip
data.value: Calculates the detailed route for the given stations, using the specified routing options respecting the defined exceptionPaths NOTE: just info.cost / info.distance / info.time will be set to "0" in Route response when all stations are identical

data.name: radCalcExtRoute.ToolTip
data.value: Calculates the detailed route for the given stations, using the specified routing options respecting both the defined exceptionPaths and CountryInfoOptions NOTE: just route.info.cost / route.info.distance / route.info.time will be set to "0" in ExtendedRoute response when all stations are identical

data.name: radCalcTour.ToolTip
data.value: Calculates a tour considering break and rest rules (defined by the native profile configured in the xRoute profile). All arrival times at stations and segments will be extended by break, rest, waiting times and so on. Please note that the driver is always considered as being rested. Restrictions: A tour point must not use fuzzy linking. The routing option IS_DESTTIME must be false. Dynamic and road editor routing must also be disabled.

data.name: cboDetailLevel.ToolTip
data.value: BORDERS : Only Borders VERY_IMPORTANT : entering, leaving and changing highways; entering ferries STANDARD : all manoeuvres LESS_IMPORTANT : all road changes OTHER_OPPORTUNITIES : nodes with more than one trailing segment ORTHOGONAL : additional optional manouvre NOTE: This level cannot be requested. All manoeuvres which are additonal manoeuvres like brunnel manoeuvres have detail ORTHOGONAL. ALL : all the rest

data.name: labCostsDistance.ToolTip
data.value: This textbox expects a comma separated list of 8 cost values. They will be multiplied with the distance values of the RouteInfo objects and therefore simulate cost computation based on cost/km. This is client logic and may be used e.g. for 20 Euros / 100km highway 15 Euros / 100km country road.... and so on.

data.name: tbxCostsPeriod.ToolTip
data.value: This textbox expects a comma separated list of 8 cost values. They will be multiplied with the period values of the RouteInfo objects and therefore simulate cost computation based on cost/minute. This is client logic and may be used e.g. for 20 Euros / 1hour highway 15 Euros / 1hour country road.... and so on. The basevalue is 1 second, so /hour has to be multiplied with 3600.

data.name: tbxCostsDistance.ToolTip
data.value: This textbox expects a comma separated list of 8 cost values. They will be multiplied with the distance values of the RouteInfo objects and therefore simulate cost computation based on cost/km. This is client logic and may be used e.g. for 20 Euros / 100km highway 15 Euros / 100km country road.... and so on. The basevalue is 1 meter, so /100km has to be multiplied with 100000.

data.name: labEMISSION_TECHNOLOGY.ToolTip
data.value: Describes the technology type of emission reduction for trucks. (emission only, from HBEFA version 3.1). Legal Values are: NONE - no emission reduction technology (default) EGR - exhaust gas recirculation SCR - selective catalytic reduction

data.name: tbxVP_EMISSION_TECHNOLOGY.ToolTip
data.value: Describes the technology type of emission reduction for trucks. (emission only, from HBEFA version 3.1). Legal Values are: NONE - no emission reduction technology (default) EGR - exhaust gas recirculation SCR - selective catalytic reduction

data.name: labTRAILER_HAS_BREAKS.ToolTip
data.value: Deprecated parameter. (toll only) This parameter now will not be evaluated. Defines whether the trailer has brakes or not. NOTE for later use: in Version 2, this parameter will be reactivated as TRAILER_HAS_BRAKES, when being evaluated eventually.

data.name: labCYLINDER_CAPACITY.ToolTip
data.value: the cylinder capacity of this vehicle [ccm] (toll and emission) Legal values are >= 0 Default capacity is 3000 ccm (suitable for trucks) Note: Set 0 when a car is in focus, because cylinder capacity is not specified for cars

data.name: tbxVP_TRAILER_HAS_BREAKS.ToolTip
data.value: Deprecated parameter. (toll only) This parameter now will not be evaluated. Defines whether the trailer has brakes or not. NOTE for later use: in Version 2, this parameter will be reactivated as TRAILER_HAS_BRAKES, when being evaluated eventually.

data.name: tbxVP_CYLINDER_CAPACITY.ToolTip
data.value: the cylinder capacity of this vehicle [ccm] (toll and emission) Legal values are >= 0 Default capacity is 3000 ccm (suitable for trucks) Note: Set 0 when a car is in focus, because cylinder capacity is not specified for cars

data.name: labTYPE.ToolTip
data.value: The vehicle type (toll and emission) Legal values are: CAR - car VAN - truck less than 7.5 t total weight TRU - truck more than 7.5 t total weight TRL - truck with trailer COM - combustable TRU HAZ - water hazardous TRU MOT - motorbike BIK - bicycle CAM - camper/minivan BUS - bus PED - pedestrian

data.name: tbxVP_TYPE.ToolTip
data.value: The vehicle type (toll and emission) Legal values are: CAR - car VAN - truck less than 7.5 t total weight TRU - truck more than 7.5 t total weight TRL - truck with trailer COM - combustable TRU HAZ - water hazardous TRU MOT - motorbike BIK - bicycle CAM - camper/minivan BUS - bus PED - pedestrian

data.name: tbxVP_TOTAL_WEIGHT.ToolTip
data.value: The total weight of the vehicle in [kg] -including the trailer's weight- (toll and emission) Legal values are > 0 Default is 15 tons (suitable for trucks) Note: Set about 1.5 tons as a guide value for cars

data.name: labTOTAL_WEIGTH.ToolTip
data.value: The total weight of the vehicle in [kg] -including the trailer's weight- (toll and emission) Legal values are > 0 Default is 15 tons (suitable for trucks) Note: Set about 1.5 tons as a guide value for cars

data.name: gbxVehicleParameters.ToolTip
data.value: The CountryInfoVehicleOptions object is derived form the CountryInfoOptions with an additional VehicleOption array in order to set vehicle options via request. These vehicle options are used for both, toll calculation and emission calculation. The default values for all vehicle options are taken from the profile used. Vehicle parameters for toll and emission calculation. All VehicleOptions have corresponding default values defined in the properties definition files. Each VehicleOption can be assigned to a certain vehicle profile. If a VehicleOption is set in the request it dominates the entry in the appropriate properties definition file.

data.name: tbxBoundingRectanglesOffset.ToolTip
data.value:
The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of low-emission zones forbidden for the current vehicle.
Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. The default is 2500.
<0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred)
=0: No change (Default)
>0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: tbxBoundingRectanglesC.ToolTip
data.value:
The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of low-emission zones forbidden for the current vehicle.
Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. The default is 2500.
<0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred)
=0: No change (Default)
>0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: labBoundingRectanglesC.ToolTip
data.value: Defines whether and how much bounding rectangles for the route has to generated. If the count is set to 0, no bounding rectangles are computed Legal values are > 0, if the value is greater as the max number of polypoints for this route max number of polypoints -1 bounding rectangles are computed Default is 0

data.name: tbxALLOW_SEGMENT_VIOLATIONS.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the starting time of the route
in case of roadeditor routing
the time has to be described as a string using the TimeInstant syntax
Example: 1999-05-31T13:20:00-05:00
if this parameter isn't set it is assumed as now.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_ROADEDITOR is true.

data.name: labENABLE_ROADEDITOR.ToolTip
data.value: This parameter has to be used for roadeditor routing. Legal values are strings representing: 1) a valid roadeditor layer name without extension 2) the name of the sub-folder in which an adequate roadeditor layer should be present 3) an attribute set, indicated by the extension ".db" such as "attribute1.db". Given attribute must correspond with database entry. In this case the roadeditor has to be in database mode, being set by roadeditor parameter "reDBConnection" in xroute.properties NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_ROADEDITOR is true.

data.name: tbxCOST_OF_SEGMENT_VIOLATIONS.ToolTip
data.value:
Represents the starting time of the route
in case of roadeditor routing
the time has to be described as a string using the TimeInstant syntax
Example: 1999-05-31T13:20:00-05:00
if this parameter isn't set it is assumed as now.
NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_ROADEDITOR is true.

data.name: tbxENABLE_ROADEDITOR.ToolTip
data.value: This parameter has to be used for roadeditor routing. Legal values are strings representing: 1) a valid roadeditor layer name without extension 2) the name of the sub-folder in which an adequate roadeditor layer should be present 3) an attribute set, indicated by the extension ".db" such as "attribute1.db". Given attribute must correspond with database entry. In this case the roadeditor has to be in database mode, being set by roadeditor parameter "reDBConnection" in xroute.properties NOTE: This parameter is only interpreted if ENABLE_ROADEDITOR is true.

data.name: gbxRoadEditor.ToolTip
data.value: Represents one routing option. The option type is described by the enumeration RoutingParameter All RoutingOptions are optional and have default values defined in the default properties definition file. Each RoutingOption can be assigned to a certain vehicle profile If a RoutingOption is set in the request it dominates the entry in the appropriate properties definition file.

data.name: tbxAVOID_LOW_EMISSION_ZONES.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of low-emission zones forbidden for the current vehicle. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. The default is 2500. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: labAvoid_Lowemissionzones.ToolTip
data.value: The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value of low-emission zones forbidden for the current vehicle. Legal values are -99 to 2501 and BAN. The default is 2500. <0: Bonus (the minumum value -99 will reduce the cost value to a minimum, i.e. the road segments are preferred) =0: No change (Default) >0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 or BAN are interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: gbxAvoid.ToolTip
data.value: Represents one routing option. The option type is described by the enumeration RoutingParameter All RoutingOptions are optional and have default values defined in the default properties definition file. Each RoutingOption can be assigned to a certain vehicle profile If a RoutingOption is set in the request it dominates the entry in the appropriate properties definition file.

data.name: labGEODATASOURCE_LAYER.ToolTip
data.value: Adds a geodatasource layer which will be considered when executing the service method in question. The format is <geodatasource configuration>.<layer name>[.<geodata profile>][;<SQL filter>]. When using attribute names, put them into brackets, such as [id] = 42. Examples: 'default.traffic' - 'default.traffic.avoid-all' - 'default.traffic.avoid-all;[id] in (0815,4711)'. The SQL filter will be attached at the end of the WHERE clause. Valid expressions are comparisons (<, >, =, like, ...). Concatinations of expressions are possible with the SQL operators AND and OR.

data.name: labExtSegments.ToolTip
data.value:
Alternative description representing a route path (optional). This is an external representiation consisting of a list of provider's segment ID's (e.g. NavTeq).
The syntax for this description is: LINESTRINGSEG(<segID> <dir> <countryCode>[,<segID> <dir> <countryCode>]*)
<segID> = provider ID <dir> = the digitalization direction <countryCode> = the countryCode representing the country the segment belongs to
Example: LINESTRINGSEG(78620413 0 49,540932189 1 49,540933595 1 49)
NOTE: The SegmentIDs of certain countries will only be taken into account when the corresponding IDMapping layer could be initialized. (see logging of list of countries initialized when xRoute Server is started)

data.name: tbxExtSegments.ToolTip
data.value:
Alternative description representing a route path (optional). This is an external representiation consisting of a list of provider's segment ID's (e.g. NavTeq).
The syntax for this description is: LINESTRINGSEG(<segID> <dir> <countryCode>[,<segID> <dir> <countryCode>]*)
<segID> = provider ID <dir> = the digitalization direction <countryCode> = the countryCode representing the country the segment belongs to
Example: LINESTRINGSEG(78620413 0 49,540932189 1 49,540933595 1 49)
NOTE: The SegmentIDs of certain countries will only be taken into account when the corresponding IDMapping layer could be initialized. (see logging of list of countries initialized when xRoute Server is started)

data.name: tbxAbsMalus.ToolTip
data.value:
Describes an absolute optional Malus in seconds which will be added in total to the segments in the according ExceptionPath. If absTimeMalus is negative, its absolute value will be added to each of the segments in the according ExceptionPath.
Default: 0
NOTE: If the absolute time malus is set and does not equal 0, relMalus will be ignored.

data.name: tbxRelMalus.ToolTip
data.value:
The malus or bonus value in percent which has to be added to the base cost value.
Legal values are -99 to 2501.
<0: Bonus (the minumum value -99
=0: No change (Default)
>0: Malus (the maximum value 2501 is interpreted as road segments blocked)

data.name: tbxStreet.ToolTip
data.value:
Alternative description representing an optional list of segments which match certain street names resp. street numbers.
The list of segments includes all segments which match at least one of the street names resp. street numbers
The syntax for this description is:
<streetname>[/<streetname>]*
NOTE: absTimeMalus will be ignored, if this attribute is non-empty, instead relMalus will be considered.
NOTE: If more than one ExceptionPath elements contain a non-empty 'street' attribute, only the last occurrence will be considered.

data.name: labStreet.ToolTip
data.value:
Alternative description representing an optional list of segments which match certain street names resp. street numbers.
The list of segments includes all segments which match at least one of the street names resp. street numbers
The syntax for this description is:
<streetname>[/<streetname>]*
NOTE: absTimeMalus will be ignored, if this attribute is non-empty, instead relMalus will be considered.
NOTE: If more than one ExceptionPath elements contain a non-empty 'street' attribute, only the last occurrence will be considered.

data.name: gbxExceptionPath.ToolTip
data.value: Describes a route path which has to be treated as ExceptionPath in the next route calculation. Use this option to calculate alternative routes, for example. NOTE: Only the first non-empty attribute 'nodes', 'extSegments', 'street', and 'binaryPathDesc' is considered. NOTE: If a street segment occurs in more than one instance of ExceptionPath, the final malus for this street segment will be computed as the average of the given maluses. There is on exception to this rule: If the street segment in question occurs in an ExceptionPath element with a malus of -99, the final malus will also be -99. This mechanism allows the client to compute an alternative route by still forcing xRoute to use a special street segment (e.g. a ferry).
